group_1.textCenter: Okay, so the purpose of this meeting is to@figure out how to attract customers…

group_1.textRight: Sure, I do! When people say "cafe", maids are@the first thing that comes to mind!
Maids…?!

group_1.textLeft: Does wearing a maid outfit improve workplace@efficiency?

group_1.textRight: A-aren't they cute?!
That's not just my tastes in particular,@it's the general public sentiment…!
Maid outfits…@I considered it once before, but…
I thought it didn't fit the atmosphere of@our shop…

group_1.textLeft: Hm… It's a good idea… But maid outfits in@a regular old cafe are a bit too bold.

group_1.textRight: Okay, then!@How about trying out a new menu item!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, like a cute parfait that would look snazzy@on social media?!
Yeah, something like that! After we put one on@the menu at our place, it's been really busy!
Look, here's the one Takina made…

group_1.textRight: That has NEVER been on the menu!

group_1.textLeft: But it would get a lot of social media buzz.
Are you not keen on the idea, Shizuku?

group_1.textRight: Sorry… You're all working so hard on this.
I guess we should try something new.
I wanted to cherish the atmosphere of the@coffee shop we have now.
But… If I want to attract more customers,@I'll have to abandon that goal…

group_1.textLeft: Hm… What's the most important thing to you@right now, Shizuku?

group_1.textRight: First of all, I don't want the shop to go out@of business...
I want to take care of what we already have,@but I also want to try something new.
And I also want our coffee to be the very@best around, and…
I'm sorry, that didn't narrow it down at all...

group_1.textLeft: No, it's totally fine, isn't it?@Let's make this happen!

group_1.textRight: Eh…?

group_1.textLeft: To sum it all up.
You want to mix things up a bit, without@changing the shop's core principles?

group_1.textRight: …Yes.

group_1.textLeft: So then, while protecting all the things that@are important to you, Shizuku…
We'll come up with new ways to do things!

group_1.textRight: ...But how in the world can we do that?

group_1.textLeft: How about holding some limited time events?
It would only be for a short time, so it's a good@chance to challenge yourself.
That's how you can attract new customers@and help them connect with the shop!

group_1.textRight: Then, based on the input everyone gave@earlier...
A limited time event aimed at younger crowd with@a change of menus, uniforms, and other stuff…

group_1.textLeft: We'll call it a "Cafe Buzz Event!"@Or something like that!
Non-alcoholic coffee shops aren't in vogue,@so let's show off how good they are!
It seems that girls these days prefer puddings@and cream sodas!

group_1.textRight: Those might be easier to do since we already@have versions of them on the menu.
And then! And then!@Why don't I perform a skit for everyone?!

group_1.textLeft: …Maybe we should hand out flyers. It'll be worth@a shot if we can get more eyes on the event.
And even if it's not popular, it should generate@more foot traffic…
I have some accounting experience, so I'll teach@you the basics.

group_1.textRight: Is that so? Thank you so much.

group_1.textLeft: So is that everything sorted?

group_1.textRight: Well, things are still in the planning stages,@and we don't know if it'll work out…
...But I think I'll sleep better tonight.

group_1.textLeft: Hurray! Mission Clear!

group_1.textRight: With that settled, here's a quick joke for ya!
Where there's a whale, there's a way!
…[wait:0.8][chara:300701:cheek_0][chara:300701:lipSynch_1]The phrase is normally "Where there's a will,@there's a way."
Ayaka has swapped "whale" for "will…"
That's the joke. I don't think even a whale@enthusiast would find it amusing.

group_1.textLeft: Huh, she really did explain the joke afterwards.
Shizuku is very knowledgeable.

group_1.textRight: …Haha.
I knew the gag would work better when@Shizuku laughed along!
It's embarrassing to have to explain them@by myself...
…Was Shizuku actually laughing there?

group_1.textLeft: Well, since they both seem happy, we shouldn't@sweat the details!
